title: Who composed la campanella, Liszt or Paganini? - Quora

response.answer_text: Paganini originally composed it as the rondo theme of the 3rd movement of his 2nd violin concerto. Many were enamored of, and inspired by, it’s intoxicating, bewitching beauty, including the prolific Liszt, who composed an etude based on the theme. It is contained in his “six Grandes etudes de Paganini” as the third one (that wasn’t the only Paganini that inspired him; in fact Paganini himself had a seminal impact on Liszt).

Paganini. “ Little Bell” “… Allegro spiritoso (Rondo alla campanella) or Ronde à la clochette, final movement of the Violin Concerto No. 2 in B Minor, Op. 7 But many contemporaries loved it, and Liszt arranged his own piano version and played it live till he retired from performing. Composer Gioachino Rossini, said, “I wept the first time I heard Paganini play.”
